content.description: This route climbs a splitter that seams out 6 feet before reaching the ground. Stem up between a block and the main wall, reach over, and place some gear where the crack opens up. Make a physical move with crappy feet (crux) to gain the crack, and jam your way up to the anchor. It is harder for climbers with big hands.
content.location: It ascends the left side of the west face of the tower.

content.description:
Twerk ascends the NW arete of the tower. Begin on opposing seams climbing somewhat awkward and gritty rock to a short hand crack. It shares an anchor with

Whistles

.
content.location: It climbs the NW arete of the tower.

climbs.name: Sticks and Dicks and Finer Things

content.description: This is a pretty wild and physical route. If you couldnâ€™t stem off the wall behind the route, this would be seriously burly. Stem up through the corridor, and clip a bolt. Make awkward and physical moves to gain a stance, and plug in some gear (0.75 Camalot or black Metolius). Move up and right to good holds, and plug more gear (0.5 Camalot or green Metolius). Follow the seam up, and clip another bolt before the anchor. The Metolius cams fit a little better in the pockets.
content.location: It ascends the North face of the tower.

content.description: This was the original route up the tower. Climb either the NE arete or the northern squeeze to gain the ledge below the splitter on the east face. Jam and face climb the east face to a two bolt anchor that is set back for a top belay.
content.location: Look for the short splitter on the east face of the tower.

content.description: Puffy Cheeks climbs a crescent moon-shaped flake via bolts. From the final bolt, traverse right and up to find the anchor, going straight up is probably 5.9. The anchor on this route was originally positioned to service both Puffy Cheeks and the SW arete. Unfortunately the rock quality on the arete was too poor to bolt.
content.location: It ascends the flake system on the west face of the tower.
